availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
19
The Governor Commissioned Jno. W. Reynolds Lieut. Col. of the Enrolled Militia
He commissioned the following Majors of the Enrolled Militia Richd T. Jacobs and Jno. J Marshall for Oldham County. E S. Mastin and N. J. Hughes for Jackson county and Coleman Benton for Estill

He commissioned the following persons in the Enrolled Militia with the Rank of Captain. J. M. Gwinn Adjutant, A. R. Beckett Quartermaster, A. M. Elder Paymaster and B. D. Owen Surgeon for Clinton County, Jabez Bingham Adjutant, F. M. Oakley, Quartermaster, M. E. McKinzie Paymaster and M Northington Surgeon for Trigg county. Jas M. Jackson Adjutant, L. S. Deskins Quartermaster, M Furkerson, Paymaster and John W. Ernest Surgeon for Pike County. John Morris Adjutant, T. J. Engle Quartermaster, Jas P. Vance Paymaster and Jas D Foster Surgeon for Jackson County.
He commissioned the Captains, First Second and Third Lieutenants of the Enrolled Militia for the counties of Clinton, Estill, Trigg, McLean, Pike, Oldham and Trimble, all duly elected.
He commissioned the following persons to wit
He appointed Jass F. Bond Comr of Deeds for the State of New Jersey (Newark)
He remitted to T. S. Fontaine a Judgment of the Frankfort Police Court of $50 for carrying concealed weapons.

Mar 19
The Governor Commissioned J. E. Carson Police Judge of Crab Orchard
He caused to be filed the oath of Thos Dugan Comr of Deeds for Ohio.
